title: Argentinian-Style Ribs
ingredients: 1 cup coarse salt, or as needed
method: Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Step 2: Coat ribs heavily with salt.
Step 3: Cook on the preheated grill until meat pulls away easily from the bone, 5 to 7 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C).
Step 4: Transfer ribs to a large glass serving dish and squeeze lime wedges over top. Serve immediately.
Step 5: Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of salt. The actual amount consumed will vary.
